title: 114_s1925
content: Extension of Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Program. Extension of Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Program to provide secure payments for states and counties containing federal land, with defined funding amounts for fiscal years 2012 through 2021. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act is amended to extend secure payments for states and counties with federal land until fiscal year 2021. Amendments include changing the calculation of payments and adjusting election dates. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act is amended to extend payments for states and counties with federal land until fiscal year 2021. Amendments include changes in payment calculations and election dates. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to allow eligible counties with major distributions to elect how to use any unexpended funds. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to allow eligible counties to reserve a portion of the balance for specific projects, limit the reserve for county payments to 7 percent, and return any unreserved balance to the Treasury. Additionally, the act is amended to include additional purposes for unexpended funds if an eligible county fails to elect how to use them. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to adjust distribution of payments to eligible counties and continue authority for special projects on federal land. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to extend termination authority to 2023 and 2024, and continue county funds for search and rescue operations. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to extend termination authority to 2023 and 2024, and continue county funds for search and rescue operations without reducing payments. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to extend termination authority to 2023 and 2024, and continue county funds for search and rescue operations without reducing payments. Additionally, a new provision is added at the end. SEC. 404 states that payments under the Act for fiscal year 2016 and beyond are exempt from spending reductions. SEC. 2 amends the Payment in Lieu of Taxes program. SEC. 3 authorizes and fully funds the Land and Water Conservation Fund. Section 200302 of title 54, United States Code is amended to remove specific date references. Section 200303 is amended to allow funds deposited in the Fund to be available for expenditure without further appropriation or fiscal year limitation. The President shall submit detailed account, program, and project allocations for funding under subsection (a) as part of the annual budget submission to Congress. Appropriations Acts may provide for alternate allocation of funds, including allocations by account and program. If Congress does not establish alternate allocations within 120 days of the fiscal year's start, the President will allocate funds under subsection (a). If Congress sets alternate allocations less than the full amount appropriated, the President will allocate the difference. The President will allocate any difference between the appropriated amount and alternate allocation if Congress does not establish alternate allocations within 120 days. An annual report detailing the final allocation of funds must be submitted to Congress. The amendment to Section 200306 of title 54, United States Code, requires 1.5 percent of annual authorized funding to be used for projects that provide public access to Federal land for recreational purposes like hunting and fishing.
